intro: Cryptantha dichita, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha dichita is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in full sun.
